intro: Thomsonia hookeri, commonly known as the slender thomsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Thomsonia hookeri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
